tourBios.otherInfo: Joined the Champions Tour in 1995 after earning a full-exemption by finishing T6 at the 1994 National Qualifying Tournament...Has played in 55 events in his Champions Tour career and has three top-25 efforts...Played the PGA TOUR on a regular basis from 1967-1976 and made the cut in 235 of 326 total events, with two victories. Had PGA TOUR career earnings of $421,938 and his best year was 1972 when he was 11th on the money list with $110,151...Won the 1972 Tournament of Champions when he came from two strokes back to tie Jack Nicklaus after 72 holes and then rolled in a 20-foot birdie putt on the first playoff hole...Claimed his first victory on the PGA TOUR a year earlier when he won the 1971 Cleveland Open by seven strokes...Served a stint as a teaching professional in Finland...Accumulated 16 holes-in-one during his career...Was selected as the Player of the Year by the Carolinas Golf Writers in 1967.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Champions was T12th in 1995 at the The Transamerica.
